content.description: Starts to the left of the crack, and then moves right at the second bolt to the crimpy slightly overhanging face. Clipping the anchors is really hard for short people. It looks like a bad fall, too, but really isn't.
content.location: The left route of the two bolted climbs on the very right of the Bibliotek wall, just to the right of a wide often-wet crack.

content.description:
One of the tough things about finding these routes is that they all look the same. The guidebook helps here.

This fun, juggy line has great movement and some engaging cruxes that lead to a spooky final crux section just below the anchors.
content.location: Just right of the big tree- Look for the circle (it says .12a on it)- also look for the thin, flat horizontal pinch that is unique to this route.

climbs.name: Tea at the Palaz of Hoon

content.description: The last route on the main Bibliotek wall, right before the large amphitheater. Traverse farther left from the shared start of the Love Song of J. Alfred Prufrock.
Second route from the right on the main Bibliotek wall. Bouldery overhanging climbing for ~30-35 feet, followed by easier but reachy vetrical finish after pulling over the bulge.

Pull on and climb through 5 feet of jugs then enter a reachy sequence that leads to paddling on decent holds with an occasional jug rest higher up. With lesser rock quality and quite a bit of sand up high, this one doesn't quite live up to the reputation of its neighbor.
content.location: The leftmost line of the three taller 5.11c's that stand alone in the middle of the crag.

climbs.name: The Short, Happy Life of Francis Macomber

content.description: Worth doing if for nothing else than to get used to the rock here- an engaging start through the first two bolts leads to easy climbing above.
content.location: Start left of the obvious crack that separates the main wall from the smaller wall on the right.

content.description: 4th line from the right on the main Bibliotek wall, has a prominent sloper sticking out before the first bolt.
A route between All the Pretty Horses and The Unbearable Lightness of Being, starts on two underclings.

climbs.name: The Love Song of J. Alfred Prufrock

content.description: Start on the far left of the Bibliotek wall Shares start with another route that goes left, but this one climbs a line straight up from the start.

A steep short climb with plenty of Red River Gorge finger buckets. The crux can be done by making a few extra moves out left or one big move to a jug. A fall from the third could result in decking if your belayer isn't careful.
This is the flake to the left of Who Pooped in the Park?  It certainly is not a classic and felt harder than the 5.6 rating in the book.
content.protection: Standard rack of cams up to #4.  Finish on anchors of The Short Happy Life of Francis Macomber

content.description:
While reading The Sound and the Fury is a bit of mental workout, this route is much more of physical challenge.

The Fury is the obvious line on the left side of the Bibliothek. Incredibly steep for the grade, this route is formidable test of forearm endurance. Climb onto a ledge by the first bolt, take a deep breath, and sprint for the anchors. If you're grabbing a bad hold, you're probably doing it wrong. Classic!
content.location: The obvious, chalked line on the left side of the Bibliothek. The metal tags at the base of the routes are helpful if you get lost.

climbs.name: Everything That Rises Must Converge
climbs.fa: Josh Thurston, Ron Bateman, Josh LaMar in 2009

content.description: 3rd sport route from the right on the main wall
Punch through a short, steep section to gain a good stance. Cruise a few feet of easy terrain then start firing through sequential moves on sharp pockets and underclings to the top.
content.location: Far left side of Bibliothek, this is the first of the three short routes on the often muddy ledge.

content.description: Establish on sharp pockets and follow good holds to a pair of underclings below a small roof. Surmount the roof and continue on jugs to a break. The chalk and ticks have likely washed away, so do a bit of route finding and make your way to the chains.
content.location: The last route on the wall at the end of the short pocketed face that sits on the ledge above the trail to Persepolis. This route has a small roof just above the third bolt.

climbs.name: All The Pretty Horses
climbs.fa: Josh Thurston, Ron Bateman, TJ Halls in 2007

content.description: 5th sport route from the right, on the main bibliotek wall.
Short, mossy, possibly damp right-angling hand crack. Still pretty fun though.
content.protection: Hand-sized gear. Maybe a couple smaller (.75 C4) sizes. Chain anchors.
content.location: Not a part of the main Bibliothek wall. When approaching from Animal Crackers, this route is to the right of the trail before rounding the corner to the main wall.

climbs.name: A Portrait of the Artist as a Young Man
climbs.fa: Ron Bateman, Josh Thurston, Betsey Adams. 2008.

content.description: Step up off the ground and pull some fun moves trending a bit left. It becomes apparent quickly what kind of climbing you'll be doing...steep, continuous pulling on mostly good pockets as you fight the pump towards the top. An obvious crux comes about 2/3rds the way up as the holds lessen in jugability. Some less-than-obvious holds help here.  Climb better holds to the finish.
content.location:
Just left of

The Unbearable Lightness of Being

starting between the large boulder and the cliff. When lowering, you'll end up on this boulder.

climbs.name: A Confederacy of Dunces
climbs.fa: Joel Handley, Kipp Trummel, Ron Bateman, 2008

content.description: The first 3 bolts are a little rough, but the overhanging climbing above is better quality.
This is probably the best route on the wall- an engaging start past a thin section leads to five fun jugs above.
content.location: The rightmost route on the wall.
